page.title: 13THURSTON LOCALITY NEWS
page.content: REPORTS FROM THE LOCAL PRESS 1 Thurston CEVC Primary School. The East Anglian Daily Times of 16-7-85 carried a report of the concern of the Governors of the school over possible overcrowding of the school. From 1985 onwards, Thurston was set to expand considerably,and it was felt that the school would need a permanent extension,instead of mobile classrooms, to cope with the expected rise in numbers. The Governors wished to be assured that the Education Authority was aware of the impending rise in numbers and was planning accordingly. The Headmaster was sure that the necessary resources would be available and the Area Education Officer said that a submission for a permanent extension would be made in autumn 1985.
